numlitem.para: Accepted procedures are established and used,
Door is visually verified closed and flush with the fuselage before each departure,
Latches are visually verified to be fully extended before each departure,
Door control system is deactivated by an accepted procedures, and
Repairs are made within 30 flight hours.
Prior to each departure, ensure nose cargo door has been verified closed, latched, locked and the control system deactivated.

placard.para: Install Placards below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel and on Nose Cargo Door Control Panel: "LOADMASTER NOSE CARGO DOOR CONTROLS INOP". Enter items in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Log at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify that the door is closed and flush with the fuselage:

para.emphasis: CHECK THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF DOOR PATH. SERIOUS INJURY TO PERSONNEL OR EQUIPMENT COULD OCCUR.

numlitem.para: Close the nose cargo door by either Normal or Manual Operation procedures (AMM 52-31-00).
Visually check that the nose cargo door is flush with the fuselage around the entire circumference of the door frame.
Visually verify all 16 latches are fully extended, check that each latch pin is extended to a position that is within + 0.1 inch of the visible end of the bushing (see illustration below).
